creditline: The Walter C. and Mary C. Briggs Trust
description: silver tureen with vertical lines on the body of the tureen and move upwards onto the lid; amber colored rounded handle with green tip on top of lid, nestled in curving four curving leaves that alternate with four bunches of small berries; legs of tureen are acorns, grouped in pairs; inner lining with round inner ring inside tureen
markings: on bottom base of tureen: hallmark stamp | at top of lid on inner side: hallmark stamp | outer edge of inner right: hallmark stamp
text: The name Georg Jensen has been synonymous with 20th century Scandinavian design almost since the young Danish silversmith opened the eponymous silversmiths’ atelier and retail shop in Copenhagen in 1904. Jensen’s first ambition was as a sculptor but, unable to make a living in that field, he turned to silver, designing jewelry, tablewares and serving pieces to which he brought the sculptor’s understanding of volume and three-dimensional modeling.
title: Soup tureen
